intro: Lipocarpha tenera, commonly known as the slender marsh sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in wetland environments, such as marshes and shallow water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
